flow.descriptionCdata:
a96fd48f-dd8a-4581-90c6-6c40353937f8.1e4abd09-1a07-4472-8326-76f05c04194b.description=Executes a Shell command(s) on the remote machine using the SSH protocol. Inputs\: host - The hostname/IP address of the remote machine. port - The port number for SSH protocol. Default value\: 22 username - Name of the account on the remote machine. password - The passwod for the username. If using a private key file, this will be used as the passphrase for the file. privateKeyFile - Path to private key file (OpenSSH type) on the machine where is the worker. knownHostsPolicy - The policy used for managing known_hosts file. We recommand to use a "strict" policy so as to verify the host key against a local file containing known, trustworthy machines. If you choose "allow" or "add" policy then you will connect to the server without any verification. If there is a Man-In-The-Middle attack then you will be connected to a fake server and the SSH commands that you send will go through that fake server. Valid values\: allow\=It will permit the connection to any hosts. strict\=It will permit the connection only to the hosts specified in known_hosts file. add\=It will permit the connection to any hosts, if the host is not in the known_hosts file it will be added. Default value\: strict command - The command(s) to execute. characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the remote machine. Examples\: SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8 Default value\: UTF-8 pty - Whether to use a pseudo-terminal (PTY) session. Valid values\: false, true Default value\: false timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete. Default value\: 90000 connectTimeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the connection to be made. Default value\: 10000 closeSession - If true it closes the SSH session at completion of this operation. If false the SSH session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. Valid values\: false, true Default value\: false useGlobalContext - Specifies whether to enable the session sharing into the subflows. Valid values\: false, true Default value\: false Results\: returnResult - The result of the command (STDOUT is success, otherwise STDERR). STDERR - The standard error of the command. STDOUT - The standard output of the command. exitStatus - The exit status of the remote command corresponding to the SSH channel. The exit status is only available for certain types of channels, and only after the channel was closed (more exactly, just before the channel is closed). Examples\: 0 for a successful command, -1 if the command was not yet terminated (or this channel type has no command), 126 if the command cannot execute. TimedOut - Is set to "true" if the value set in the "timeout" input has elapsed and the command timed out. Responses\: success - The command was executed successfully. failure - The command could not be executed or if the command was not yet terminated. Notes\: 1. If the SSH session is cached then only the connection is kept and not the context (variables) represented by SSH channel. 2. Hidden inputs\: knownHostsPath - Specifies the path to the known_hots file on the running server. Default value\: /.ssh/known_hosts Examples\: /home/admin/.ssh/known_hosts 3. In order to use private keys with different encryption types (ex.\: aes256-cbc) needs to be updated the /java/lib/security/local_policy.jar JAR file with one that accept all security policies (ex.\: http\://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jce-7-download-432124.html). After update you must restart the Studio or Central service. 4. The "timeout" input refers only to the command timeout and it's not linked with any kind of connection timeout. The "commandTimedOut" output shows if the command timed out and doesn't interfere with the returnResult, STDERR or STDOUT outputs, so even if the command times out these outputs will still be populated accordingly. a96fd48f-dd8a-4581-90c6-6c40353937f8.2465bcca-3afe-48d0-b49f-dc1e0736600f.description=Executes a Shell command(s) on the remote machine using the SSH protocol. Default value\: 22 username - Name of the account on the remote machine. password - The passwod for the username. If using a private key file, this will be used as the passphrase for the file. privateKeyFile - Path to private key file (OpenSSH type) on the machine where is the worker. knownHostsPolicy - The policy used for managing known_hosts file. We recommand to use a "strict" policy so as to verify the host key against a local file containing known, trustworthy machines. If you choose "allow" or "add" policy then you will connect to the server without any verification. If there is a Man-In-The-Middle attack then you will be connected to a fake server and the SSH commands that you send will go through that fake server. Valid values\: allow\=It will permit the connection to any hosts. strict\=It will permit the connection only to the hosts specified in known_hosts file. add\=It will permit the connection to any hosts, if the host is not in the known_hosts file it will be added. Default value\: strict command - The command(s) to execute. characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the remote machine. Examples\: SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8 Default value\: UTF-8 pty - Whether to use a pseudo-terminal (PTY) session. Valid values\: false, true Default value\: false timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete. Default value\: 90000 connectTimeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the connection to be made. Default value\: 10000 closeSession - If true it closes the SSH session at completion of this operation. If false the SSH session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. Valid values\: false, true Default value\: false useGlobalContext - Specifies whether to enable the session sharing into the subflows. Valid values\: false, true Default value\: false Results\: returnResult - The result of the command (STDOUT is success, otherwise STDERR). STDERR - The standard error of the command. STDOUT - The standard output of the command. exitStatus - The exit status of the remote command corresponding to the SSH channel. The exit status is only available for certain types of channels, and only after the channel was closed (more exactly, just before the channel is closed). Examples\: 0 for a successful command, -1 if the command was not yet terminated (or this channel type has no command), 126 if the command cannot execute. Responses\: success - The command was executed successfully. failure - The command could not be executed or if the command was not yet terminated. Notes\: 1. If the SSH session is cached then only the connection is kept and not the context (variables) represented by SSH channel. 2. Hidden inputs\: knownHostsPath - Specifies the path to the known_hots file on the running server. Default value\: /.ssh/known_hosts Examples\: /home/admin/.ssh/known_hosts 3. In order to use private keys with different encryption types (ex.\: aes256-cbc) needs to be updated the /java/lib/security/local_policy.jar JAR file with one that accept all security policies (ex.\: http\://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jce-7-download-432124.html). After update you must restart the Studio or Central service. 4. The "timeout" input refers only to the command timeout and it's not linked with any kind of connection timeout. The "commandTimedOut" output shows if the command timed out and doesn't interfere with the returnResult, STDERR or STDOUT outputs, so even if the command times out these outputs will still be populated accordingly. a96fd48f-dd8a-4581-90c6-6c40353937f8.382909e5-54f9-4989-a173-fd310200dded.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
a96fd48f-dd8a-4581-90c6-6c40353937f8.88c5bc64-6687-41f9-aece-11b35e490bf3.description=Executes a Shell command(s) on the remote machine using the SSH protocol. Default value\: 22 username - Name of the account on the remote machine. password - The passwod for the username. If using a private key file, this will be used as the passphrase for the file. privateKeyFile - Path to private key file (OpenSSH type) on the machine where is the worker. knownHostsPolicy - The policy used for managing known_hosts file. If the SSH session is cached then only the connection is kept and not the context (variables) represented by SSH channel. 2. In order to use private keys with different encryption types (ex.\: aes256-cbc) needs to be updated the /java/lib/security/local_policy.jar JAR file with one that accept all security policies (ex.\: http\://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jce-7-download-432124.html). flow.name: Deploy
